content: so... I'm looking at this: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-detectedissue-category.html
it seems like a something pulled straight out of a pharmacy system
they all seem like ok issue categories but it is very incomplete
the issue is this is currently classified as preferred
i'm kinda thinking it needs downgrading to example ??
the sort of categories i'd like a CDSS to report are things like "missing examamination finding" (ie listen to their chest doctor!)
and "test not required" - (ie no this 42yo woman does not need and ECG or a coag profile)
and also "missing test result" (you've told me this person is having major surgery and and cant walk up stairs, we need some kind proper cardiac assessment)
also not sure where blood test - drug warnings would go... "climbing creatinine|LFTs" with ongoing NSAID|paracetamol
looking at "operation outcome" - arguably some of these things could go in there but the issue type codes dont really seem relevant
Preferred says "we'd encourage people to use these codes if they apply and there isn't a strong need to use something else". Preferred doesn't say the code set is necessarily complete.
oh right sweet
but the wording says If the data type is CodeableConcept, then one of the coding values SHOULD be from the specified value set, but another code and/or text can be used in its place.
I'm still thinking SHOULD be suggests that FHIR.org reckons the existing list is adequate
and it really isnt (IMHO)
inadequate in that it is clearly derived from pharmacy and lab ordering
BTW, this isn't quite a CDS Hooks issue.
oh - is there a better stream @Josh Mandel ? this resource seems to be primary mechanism by which a CDS could express itself... but happy to be directed :-)
By default, spec issues should be in the Implementer's stream
cool thanks. i had a little read on the cds hooks project - looks very interesting @Josh Mandel
